column2: In a 300 metres race A beats B by 40 m or 8 seconds. A's time over the course is:
column13: * B runs 40 m in 8 sec. B covers 300 m in ( (8/40​) ×300 ​ )=60sec. B's time over the course = 60 sec. A's time over the course (60-8) sec = 52 sec.

column2: A can run 15 m while B runs 25 m. In a kilometre race B beats A by:
column13: * When B runs 25 m, A runs 30/2 ​ m. When B runs 1000 m, A runs ( (30/2) ×(1/25)​×1000)m = 600m. B beats A by 400 m.

column2: In a 800 m race, the ratio of the speeds of two contestants A and B is 2:1. A has a start of 240 m. Then, A wins by:
column13: *Step 1: Understand the race setup Total race distance = 800 m A starts 240 m ahead (head start) A needs to cover: 800 - 240 = 560 m B starts from 0 m, needs to cover 800 m Step 2: Analyze the speed ratio Speed ratio A:B = 2:1 This means A is twice as fast as B When A covers 2 m, B covers 1 m Step 3: Calculate distance covered by B when A finishes A covers 560 m to reach the finish line In the same time, B covers: (1/2) × 560 = 280 m Step 4: Calculate winning margin When A finishes at 800 m, B is at 280 m Distance B still needs to cover = 800 - 280 = 520 m A wins by 520 m Step 5: Verification Time taken by A = 560 ÷ (speed of A) Distance by B in same time = 280 m (since B is half as fast) B's remaining distance = 800 - 280 = 520 m Therefore, A wins by 520 m.

column2: X runs 5/2 times as fast as Y. If X gives Y a start of 120 meters, how far must the winning post be so that X and Y might reach it at the same time?
column13: *Step 1: Understand the speed relationship X runs 5/2 times as fast as Y Speed of X = (5/2) × Speed of Y Speed ratio X:Y = 5:2 Step 2: Set up the race conditions Let the winning post be at distance D from the starting point X starts from 0 and covers distance D Y gets a 120 m head start, so Y covers (D - 120) m They reach at the same time Step 3: Use time equation (Time = Distance/Speed) Time for X = D / Speed_X Time for Y = (D - 120) / Speed_Y Since they take the same time: D / 5 = (D - 120) / 2 Step 4: Solve for D Cross multiply: 2D = 5(D - 120) 2D = 5D - 600 \-3D = -600 D = 200 meters Step 5: Verification X covers 200 m at speed ratio 5 Y covers 80 m (200-120) at speed ratio 2 Time ratio: 200/5 = 40 units, 80/2 = 40 units Therefore, the winning post must be 200 meters from the starting point.

column2: In a 200 m race, P can beat Q by 40 m, and Q can beat R by 10 m. In the same race, P can beat R by:
column13: *Step 1: Find the speed ratio of P and Q When P covers 200 m, Q covers 160 m (beaten by 40 m) Speed ratio P:Q = 200:160 = 5:4 Step 2: Find the speed ratio of Q and R When Q covers 200 m, R covers 190 m (beaten by 10 m) Speed ratio Q:R = 200:190 = 20:19 Step 3: Combine the ratios to find P:R P:Q = 5:4 = 25:20 (multiply by 5 to match Q's value) Q:R = 20:19 (Q is already 20) Combined ratio P:Q:R = 25:20:19 Step 4: Calculate how much P beats R When P covers 200 m, R covers: (19/25) × 200 = 152 m P beats R by: 200 - 152 = 48 m Therefore, in a 200 m race, P can beat R by 48 m.

column2: In a race of 100 m, P can beat Q by 10 m and R by 19 m. In a race of 300 m, Q will beat R by:
column13: *Step 1: Find speed ratios from the 100 m race When P covers 100 m, Q covers 90 m Speed ratio P:Q = 100:90 = 10:9 Step 2: Find P's ratio with R When P covers 100 m, R covers 81 m Speed ratio P:R = 100:81 Step 3: Determine Q:R ratio P:Q = 10:9 = 100:90 (multiply by 10) P:R = 100:81 (already matching) Combined ratio P:Q:R = 100:90:81 Speed ratio Q:R = 90:81 = 10:9 Step 4: Calculate result in 300 m race When Q covers 300 m, R covers: (9/10) × 300 = 270 m Q beats R by: 300 - 270 = 30 m Therefore, in a 300 m race, Q will beat R by exactly 30 meters.

column2: Three swimmers, X, Y, and Z, swim a race, with swimmer X finishing 15 meters ahead of swimmer Y and 20 meters ahead of swimmer Z, while swimmer Y finishes 10 meters ahead of swimmer Z. Each swimmer swims the entire distance at a constant speed. What was the length of the race?
column13: *Step 1: Set up the race conditions Let the race length = L meters When X finishes L meters: Y has covered (L - 15) meters Z has covered (L - 20) meters Step 2: Establish Y and Z relationship When Y finishes L meters, Z has covered (L - 10) meters This gives us speed ratio Y:Z = L:(L - 10) Step 3: Find Y:Z ratio from X's finish Speed ratio X:Y:Z = L:(L-15):(L-20) Speed ratio Y:Z = (L-15):(L-20) Step 4: Equate the two Y:Z ratios Since both represent the same speed ratio: (L-15)/(L-20) = L/(L-10) Step 5: Solve for L Cross multiply: (L-15)(L-10) = L(L-20) Expand: L² - 10L - 15L + 150 = L² - 20L Simplify: L² - 25L + 150 = L² - 20L Cancel L²: -25L + 150 = -20L Solve: 150 = 5L L = 30 meters Step 6: Verification When X finishes 30m: Y at 15m, Z at 10m → Y:Z = 15:10 = 3:2 When Y finishes 30m: Z at 20m → Y:Z = 30:20 = 3:2 Y finishes 10m ahead of Z: 30 - 20 = 10 Therefore, the length of the race was 30 meters.

column2: A car approaches a tunnel AB. Inside the tunnel is a bird located at a point that is 1/4th of the distance AB measured from the entrance A. When the car honks, the bird flies. If the bird flies to the entrance A of the tunnel, the car catches the bird exactly at the entrance. If the bird flies to the exit B of the tunnel, the car catches the bird at exactly the exit. What is the ratio of the speed of the car to the speed of the bird?
column13: *Step 1: Set up the problem Let tunnel length = L Bird's initial position = L/4 from entrance A Car's distance from entrance A = d Speed of car = v_c, Speed of bird = v_b Step 2: Scenario 1 - Bird flies to entrance A Bird's distance to A = L/4 Car's distance to A = d Both take the same time: (L/4)/v_b = d/v_c Therefore: L/(4v_b) = d/v_c ... equation (1) Step 3: Scenario 2 - Bird flies to exit B Bird's distance to B = 3L/4 Car's distance to B = d + L Both take the same time: (3L/4)/v_b = (d + L)/v_c Therefore: 3L/(4v_b) = (d + L)/v_c ... equation (2) Step 4: Divide equation (1) by equation (2) \[L/(4v_b)\] / \[3L/(4v_b)\] = \[d/v_c\] / \[(d+L)/v_c\] 1/3 = d/(d + L) d + L = 3d L = 2d Step 5: Find the speed ratio Substitute L = 2d into equation (1): (2d)/(4v_b) = d/v_c 2d/(4v_b) = d/v_c Cancel d: 2/(4v_b) = 1/v_c 2v_c = 4v_b v_c = 2v_b Ratio v_c : v_b = 2 : 1
